result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean J Demski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
Inform agent of all prescriptions, sign releases.

Probation may be terminated early, after 6 months with Agent's written approval and no new criminal law violations. 
No violent contact with any victim listed in the criminal complaint. Comply with any mental health/psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean J Demski

defendant.name: Demski, Sean J
defendant.address: S75 W24760 Nottingham Court, Waukesha, WI 53189

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Sean J Demski in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #1. State gives sentencing recommendations. Defendant's mother, Diane D. makes a statement on behalf of the Defendant. Atty Weathers makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT#1:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

60 DAYS HUBER (CREDIT - 0 days)

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No violent contact with: any victim listed in the criminal complaint.
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

Probation may be terminated early after 6 months with Agent's written approval and no new criminal law violations. 

COSTS:  $343.00 + $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Sean J Demski in court with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weathers requests an adjourned date for plea and sentence.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster .Defendant is not to have any violent contact with any family members. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Sean J Demski in court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.
